intro: Euphorbia soliflora, commonly known as the sunflower euphorbia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces striking yellow-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse floral structures. Euphorbia soliflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
